intro: Odontonema longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved odontonema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped, opposite leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Odontonema longifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
